intro: Tristagma felipponei, commonly known as the Felippone's tristagma, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. It has hairy, narrow leaves and thrives in well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
